intro: Scaphyglottis pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in its native arid environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or green. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
